title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 19 January 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:38 <mflorea> has quit  
00:50 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
01:10 <jvdrean> has quit  
01:29 <rrodriguez> has quit  
02:27 <tekzilla> has quit  
02:29 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
03:52 <npm\_> has joined #xwiki  
03:52 <npm> has quit  
04:35 <DrLou\_> has quit  
06:00 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
06:02 <Denis> has quit  
06:24 <SvenDowideit\_> has joined #xwiki  
06:26 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
06:26 <SvenDowideit\_> is now known as <SvenDowideit>  
07:14 <CIA-121> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r6965129 / (2 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7415: The dashboard customization should also work with the /edit/ action in inline mode ...  
07:19 <CIA-121> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r4bdb83a / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-panels/src/main/resources/Panels/NewPage.xml : XWIKI-6509: Add space selection combo box to the "Create" Panel ...  
07:28 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:36 <CIA-121> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* raa29599 / (2 files): XWIKI-7416: New Dashboard space template doesn't display properly for a newly created space ...  
07:43 <CIA-121> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r6647a3d / (8 files): [misc] Fixed file mode - http://git.io/kZwUOw  
07:52 <CIA-121> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* rdbdf362 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/resources/icons/xwiki/pagination-controls.png : XWIKI-6982: Icon background bug on non-white page background ...  
07:54 <CIA-121> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* rfe10a6e / (3 files): [misc] Optimized images - http://git.io/yiNQ3Q  
08:12 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: Lots of ui tests failing with "Element cannot be scrolled into view"  
08:12 <@sdumitriu> Any idea?  
08:12 <+mflorea> https://code.google.com/p/selenium/issues/detail?id=3075  
08:13 <+mflorea> selenium bug, but I'm looking for workarounds  
08:14 <@sdumitriu> Make the browser window really big?  
08:14 <+mflorea> one workaround is to increase the screen size of the virtual displays used on CI. Locally, if I use xvfb with 1024x768 most of the pass  
08:14 <+mflorea> yep  
08:15 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:15 <+mflorea> I'm investigating the tests that still fail locally, even on 1024x768  
08:23 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: why do we use a line-height of 999px on the section edit link (.edit\_section a) ? This looks like a hack. This explains why Selenium can't scroll the link into view, you need a screen height > 999px..  
08:23 <@sdumitriu> No idea, let me check  
08:24 <+mflorea> :| to hide the "Edit" link label  
08:25 <@sdumitriu> Yep  
08:25 <@sdumitriu> But there are other ways of doing that  
08:25 <@sdumitriu> Taking care of this  
08:25 <+mflorea> cool, thanks  
08:26 <+mflorea> moving on to other failing tests  
08:30 <CIA-121> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r4b7ef6a / (3 files): [misc] Improved codestyle - http://git.io/Uo7vHw  
08:30 <@sdumitriu> ^^^ Done  
08:31 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
08:31 <+mflorea> thanks, let's see how it goes  
08:34 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:57 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
09:06 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r9ac4222 / xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/src/test/it/org/xwiki/test/ui/EditWYSIWYGTest.java : Fix test that fails on FF3.6 - http://git.io/-e3BaQ  
09:23 <sdumitriu> has quit  
09:29 <vmassol> good morning  
09:29 <@cjdelisle> good morning  
09:30 <vmassol> mflorea: what would you like to do about "Element cannot be scrolled into view"? Revert to 2.14?  
09:31 <vmassol> we have 3 tests showing this error (out of 4) in ui tests  
09:31 <+mflorea> no, in some cases is our fault, e.g. the edit section link had a line-height of 999px and thus Selenium couldn't scroll into view (a screen height > 999px was required)  
09:32 <+mflorea> let me check the last report  
09:33 <+mflorea> all SectionTest should be fixed by Sergiu's last commit  
09:33 <+mflorea> and I'm currently investigating ClassEditorTest.testFieldNameAutoGeneration  which i can reproduce only on xvfb mode locally  
09:33 <vmassol> cool, could you explain why "a screen height > 999px was required)"?  
09:33 <vmassol> (so that I learn somethingà  
09:33 <vmassol> )  
09:34 <vmassol> oh you mean we would have needed a screen height higher than 999px for the scroll to work  
09:34 <vmassol> ?  
09:34 <+mflorea> when you click a link or a button Selenium (it seems starting with 2.15 or 2.16) tries to scroll that element into view, i.e. it tries to make that element visible  
09:35 <vmassol> ok  
09:35 <+mflorea> if the element is bigger than the viewport then it fails  
09:35 <vmassol> line-height of 999px looks dubious  
09:35 <+mflorea> most of the time there's something wrong if the clickable element doesn't fit the viewport  
09:35 <vmassol> ok found irc history  
09:36 <+mflorea> yes, it was a hack to hide the "Edit" link label, which was replaced by the edit pencil icon  
09:36 <vmassol> cool that the test forced us to fix our hack!  
09:36 <vmassol> nice catch marius!  
09:36 <+mflorea> (if you had a screen with height > 999px you could have seen the "Edit" link label floating :) )  
09:55 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r9349e91 / xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-pageobjects/src/main/java/org/xwiki/test/po/appwithinminutes/ApplicationClassEditPage.java : Attempt to fix failing test. - http://git.io/HeHBdg  
09:56 <+mflorea> I'm planning to start the 3.4RC1 release after CI finishes current builds (hold your commits)  
09:57 <vmassol> cool  
09:58 <vmassol> mflorea: let me know when the branch is created  
09:58 <vmassol> (I have some pending commit)  
09:58 <+mflorea> ok  
09:58 <vmassol> nice job of fixing the tests mflorea  
09:58 <+mflorea> thanks :)  
09:59 <vmassol> it's just a bit sad that devs have still not the habit of checking func tests after they commit  
09:59 <+mflorea> yep..  
09:59 <vmassol> I've seen you fixed stuff that should have been fixed by developers who coded the change/feature  
10:06 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:10 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <CIA-121> Denis Gervalle master \* r8867505 / (2 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7389: Unable to start the wiki with a empty DB or an old DB (without version) ...  
10:22 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:27 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
10:30 <evalica> has quit  
10:32 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <+mflorea> vmassol: re http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-1078 I haven't seen any commit to upgrade to Selenium 2.17. I could do this for 3.5M1.  
10:40 <vmassol> mflorea: I don't understand  
10:41 <vmassol> have you committed already the 2.16 upgrade?  
10:41 <+mflorea> I upgraded to 2.16.1  
10:41 <+mflorea> yes  
10:41 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <vmassol> ah… the issue wasn't closed so I changed it  
10:41 <vmassol> then 2 choices  
10:41 <vmassol> - we make 2 issues  
10:41 <+mflorea> I think it was closed :)  
10:41 <vmassol> - we upgrade to 2.17 now  
10:42 <vmassol> as you prefer  
10:42 <+mflorea> I'm ok with second option  
10:42 <vmassol> ok fine with me too  
10:46 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r62aea5b / pom.xml : XE-1078: Upgrade to Selenium 2.17 and Selenium Maven Plugin 2.2 ...  
11:09 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r5240ec0 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/resources/ApplicationResources\_lv.properties : Update translations before 3.4RC1 release. - http://git.io/9\_2UJQ  
11:10 <vmassol> marius: would be nice if you could time the release process  
11:11 <vmassol> with a time given for each part  
11:11 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:11 <vmassol> like how long it takes to update the translations, to release on maven, etc  
11:11 <vmassol> just to give us some figures  
11:11 <vmassol> and see what we should focus on improvng  
11:11 <vmassol> wdyt?  
11:13 <+mflorea> ok  
11:13 <+mflorea> I'll try  
11:29 <Enygma`> has quit  
11:46 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
11:46 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
12:08 <+mflorea> guys, I need help to understand why platform and enterprise build fail on CI  
12:09 <+mflorea> Jenkins UI doesn't help, I'm looking at the console output, but since maven runs multiple threads the output is mixed..  
12:11 <+mflorea> Denis: Jenkins suggests that your commit broke the build http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/1381/  
12:12 <+Denis> mflorea: I see it, but I do not see any relation to my commit  
12:12 <+mflorea> me neither  
12:12 <+Denis> I have build xwiki-platform-core locally with success  
12:13 <+Denis> do you understand the issue, I don't  
12:13 <+mflorea> nop  
12:13 <+mflorea> I don't  
12:14 <+Denis> we need someone who knows what is the issue, any one ?  
12:16 <+mflorea> what about XE http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise/8494/consoleText ? it complains it can't find some components  
12:24 <+Denis> mmm  
12:24 <+Denis> related  
12:26 <+Denis> but I do not know what is the good way to fix this  
12:29 <+tmortagne> Denis: what is the issue ? I see it fail to find default LoggerManager but this component is in XE for sure  
12:29 <+Denis> if it is really, it would have found it  
12:29 <+tmortagne> Denis: it is for sure  
12:29 <+Denis> it is related to the packager  
12:29 <+tmortagne> it's used by EM  
12:30 <+Denis> and the issue in platform as well  
12:30 <+tmortagne> ha so it's actually missing in the packager that's all  
12:30 <+Denis> maybe  
12:30 <+Denis> I am not really aware about that tool  
12:31 <+tmortagne> either you make your code support the possibility that there is no LoggerManager or we just add it as dependency where it's missing  
12:31 <+tmortagne> packager kind of mock a xwiki to create the hsqldb database  
12:32 <+tmortagne> so it's starting hibernate store  
12:32 <+Denis> I think the logger manager should be available where the logger is  
12:32 <+tmortagne> it'sz no  
12:32 <+tmortagne> it's not the same thing  
12:33 <+tmortagne> you can need to log without advanced stuff  
12:33 <+tmortagne> and most of all logger-api should never trigger logback  
12:33 <+Denis> true  
12:34 <+Denis> but logback or another back-end is needed to log  
12:34 <+tmortagne> yes or another backend  
12:34 <+Denis> so the logger manager should provide the backend  
12:34 <+tmortagne> so it's not API job to decide which backend  
12:35 <+Denis> it is not the api which is missing$  
12:35 <+tmortagne> I know  
12:35 <+Denis> but the implementation in relation with the backend  
12:35 <+tmortagne> and I'm telling you there is no reason you have the backedn when you just have the API as dependency  
12:36 <+tmortagne> so we just need to put the proper dependencies like we do in XE  
12:36 <+Denis> sure, but it would be silly for the store to think about the absence of a manager and the presence of a backend at the same time  
12:36 <+tmortagne> Denis: I said it was one one technical possibility I never said the store should do that  
12:37 <+Denis> It would have been better to not have direct dependency on logback, but on the logger manager  
12:37 <+tmortagne> there is no way to do what we need just with log4j API  
12:37 <+tmortagne> I would have loved it too...  
12:38 <+Denis> sure, but you may have a logger manager implementation anyway, that do something good  
12:38 <+tmortagne> s/log4j/slf4j  
12:38 <+tmortagne> that's what we have...  
12:39 <+Denis> so the logback implementation of the logger manager should provide logback, and we should not depend on logback IMO. If we want another logger, we need an implementation of the logger manager for it  
12:39 <+tmortagne> anyway you are supposed to select the proper implementation of the logging api in your app  
12:39 <+tmortagne> it doesnot make sense for a final app  to get only the API  
12:39 <+tmortagne> it's the same for many things  
12:40 <+tmortagne> Denis: I don't understand what you mean  
12:40 <+tmortagne> we need logback  
12:40 <+tmortagne> how the logger manager could not depends onlogback  
12:40 <+tmortagne> logback  
12:40 <+Denis> If you want to use log4j for exemple, you cannot without a logger manager for it  
12:41 <+tmortagne> yes  
12:41 <+tmortagne> it just need to be done  
12:41 <+tmortagne> we don't have the need ourself  
12:41 <+tmortagne> so it's not done yet  
12:41 <+tmortagne> but it's not much to do  
12:41 <+tmortagne> also log4j doe snot implements slf4j  
12:41 <+Denis> so what I said, is that your app should not depend on logback, but on the logger manager that use logback  
12:41 <+tmortagne> which is our standard API  
12:41 <+tmortagne> so that would not make much sense to have a log4j based impl  
12:42 <+tmortagne> Denis: yes and taht's exactly what we do in XE  
12:42 <+tmortagne> I never said you were supposed to trigger directly logback  
12:42 <+tmortagne> you are supposed to take the proper logging impl  
12:42 <+tmortagne> the packager is wrong that's all  
12:42 <+Denis> we should do so everywhere so  
12:43 <+tmortagne> everywhere is not much places actually  
12:43 <+tmortagne> XE, packager, test framework maybe not much more  
12:44 <+Denis> currently I have just added a test deps on old-core has you suggested  
12:45 <+Denis> but I was feeling it was not good since there is no reason to have it there in particular  
12:45 <+tmortagne> I suggested to make sure the logger impl was a test dep, not that it had to be on oldcore, it could be on generic test frameworkk  
12:45 <+Denis> it should have been  
12:45 <+tmortagne> we tend to forget to do things that are not required on the moment ;)  
12:46 <+Denis> I have not introduce the logger manager, just use it, I am not comfortable with the whole stuff  
12:46 <+tmortagne> Denis: where did I said it was your fault ?  
12:47 <+Denis> no where, but this is my commit which currently broke the build, and I am feeling guiltu  
12:47 <+Denis> :)  
12:47 <+tmortagne> no need  
12:47 <+tmortagne> fixing packager and test fmk  
12:48 <+Denis> cool  
12:48 <+mflorea> thanks tmortagne  
12:48 <+Denis> remove the deps in old core  
12:50 <+tmortagne> hmm depending on logging impl in test fmk make it a bit harder to test the logging impl, will have to do some hack  
12:51 <+Denis> but it is better to have it in one place  
12:51 <+tmortagne> yes  
12:51 <+tmortagne> maybe we need another test module  
12:52 <+tmortagne> lets start with the packager to fix the build  
12:53 <+Denis> ok, would you like I file an issue in jira ?  
12:53 <CIA-121> tmortagne master \* rb0b14f0 / xwiki-platform-tools/xwiki-platform-tool-packager-plugin/pom.xml : Missing dependency - http://git.io/bRr4Hw  
12:54 <+tmortagne> no need it's just minor build stuff  
12:54 <+tmortagne> will take care of the cleanup of oldcore and others projects too  
13:03 <gdelhumeau> Sorry for the spam!  
13:22 <mflorea> has quit  
14:16 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:24 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
14:35 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
14:43 <+jvdrean> I can't find xwiki-enterprise-wiki-3.3 in http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-wiki/  
14:44 <vmassol> it's not there naymore  
14:44 <+jvdrean> xwiki-enterprise-ui  
14:44 <vmassol> http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-ui-all/  
14:44 <+jvdrean> thanks  
14:44 <vmassol> for the full XAR  
14:44 <vmassol> if you want only the XE XAR  
14:44 <vmassol> http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-ui/  
14:44 <+jvdrean> what is -ui alone ?  
14:44 <+tmortagne> jvdrean: depends what you want  
14:44 <+tmortagne> there two now  
14:44 <vmassol> the all one contains transitivie XAR deps  
14:44 <+tmortagne> ui alone is well ui alone :)  
14:45 <+tmortagne> just the page of XE in the xar  
14:45 <+tmortagne> not all the applications  
14:45 <+jvdrean> ok  
14:45 <+jvdrean> I'm looking for -all then  
15:12 <+tmortagne> gdelhumeau: it's not the right, type, xar are "Application"  
15:16 <+jvdrean> I'll have a few questions since I'm migrating an XE-based project from 3.1 to 3.3  
15:16 <+jvdrean> resource: activitystream.hbm.xml not found  
15:17 <+jvdrean> while I'm building the hsqldb db, have we changed something in the activitystream ?  
15:17 <+jvdrean> I see there's been the eventstream module introduced during 3.2 but it doesn't seem to be a replacement  
15:20 <+tmortagne> I don't think we changed much about activitystream it's still here AFAIK  
15:22 <wrongRedirectLin> has joined #xwiki  
15:24 <wrongRedirectLin> Hi, I just switched to https and I realized that links containing redirect are missing the domain name.. do you know what I did wrong? (running xwiki 3.3)  
15:31 <vmassol> mflorea: are we good for the release?  
15:32 <+mflorea> nop, it seems selenium 2.17 upgrade broke the selenium 1 test, selenium server doesn't start because a class is missing. I'm investigating  
15:45 <+tmortagne> if we are sure it's false positives we should probably relase, WDYT ?  
15:45 <vmassol> we can easily put back 2.16  
15:45 <vmassol> and keep 2.17 for 3.5  
15:45 <+tmortagne> ( not as a general rule but as a be are late already )  
15:46 <+mflorea> it fails locally too. I'll put back 2.16.1, but first I want to see if there is any quick fix  
15:47 <+mflorea> it seems that selenium-api jar is not in the class path, but it should be because selenium-java -> selenium-firefox-driver -> selenium-remote-control -> selenium-api, so it is a transitive dependency  
15:47 <+mflorea> s/remote-control/remote-driver  
15:48 <+tmortagne> mflorea: m2eclipse does not resolve selenium-api either  
15:49 <+tmortagne> wait  
15:49 <+Denis> vmassol: the configure issue of MockingRequirement is not yet solve that I have another need which is somewhat related: the MockingRequirement is not evaluated for super-class which disallow structuring test case and sharing some code easily into an abstract class  
15:49 <+mflorea> I get it with mvn dependency:tree on enterprise-test-selenioum  
15:49 <+mflorea> +- org.seleniumhq.selenium:selenium-htmlunit-driver:jar:2.17.0:compile  
15:49 <+mflorea> [INFO] |  |  +- org.seleniumhq.selenium:selenium-api:jar:2.17.0:compile  
15:50 <+mflorea> and selenium-api contains the "missing" org.openqa.selenium.logging.LoggingHandler  
15:50 <+tmortagne> where is selenium version defined now, commons root pom ? m2eclipse has a hard time finding it  
15:50 <+mflorea> yes, in top level pom  
15:52 <+tmortagne> so I confirm, no reason to not get the selenium-api in the classpath  
15:53 <+tmortagne> are you sure it's the issue ?  
15:53 <+mflorea> yep, I get it in eclipse, and I can use LoggingHandler, so it's something different  
15:53 <+mflorea> maybe the selenium server doesn't have it  
15:55 <+tmortagne> what is the error exactly ?  
15:55 <+mflorea> selenium-maven plugin already has explicit dependency on selenium-server and selenium-remote-driver  
15:55 <+mflorea> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/973/console  
15:57 <+mflorea> if this http://seleniumhq.org/images/maven.png is right (I checked the poms and it seems right) then selenium maven plugin should have selenium-api in the class path  
16:00 <+tmortagne> maybe the selenium server is not started with the proper setup  
16:00 <+tmortagne> not sure how it's working  
16:01 <+tmortagne> mayeb you get more informations with -X  
16:01 <+tmortagne> like the command executed  
16:07 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
16:12 <sburjan> has quit  
16:15 <mflorea> has quit  
16:21 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r8c4b2ad / pom.xml : XE-1078: Upgrade to Selenium 2.17 and Selenium Maven Plugin 2.2 ...  
16:27 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
16:30 <vmassol> guys  
16:31 <vmassol> I've started a blog post to summarize what we've done since the 2009 poll about features user would like to see  
16:31 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/FeatureStatus20120119  
16:31 <vmassol> the idea is to start a new poll real soon for the 4.x cycle  
16:31 <vmassol> could you have a look and verify the status corresponds to the reality (I wrote it with my own knowledge)  
16:32 <vmassol> also if I could have some help to put links that would be great :)  
16:32 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
16:32 <vmassol> links in the first column and in the status column for Mockups  
16:32 <vmassol> first column for done stuff  
16:32 <vmassol> the blog post is not published yet  
16:32 <vmassol> I'd like to publish it later today or tomorrow  
16:32 <vmassol> thanks!  
16:33 <vmassol> (once we publish it I'll also send a mail on the list about it)  
16:38 <+Denis> vmassol: for the search, shoudn't we mention the "suggest" feature in the search box ?  
16:38 <vmassol> yep good idea, feel free to edit and add!  
16:38 <+Denis> was not sure how to say it however  
16:41 <+Denis> vmassol: same for the Document Type, we now have template for document at least  
16:41 <vmassol> yes it's not exactly the same thing but could be mentioned in the status  
16:41 <vmassol> (document type is still not implemented)  
16:44 <+Denis> vmassol: sometime you say an extension exist with a V and sometime with a X, why ?
